info.name: Commvault Rest API - Public
info.description:
Welcome
--------------
Welcome to Commvault's Rest APIs.  You can explore our APIs in [Postman](https://getpostman.com) using the predefined requests we created.

Setup
--------------
To get started, [create an environment in Postman](https://www.getpostman.com/docs/environments), select that environment, and set your environment variables by entering your platform API keys in the `0 - Setup/Environment Setup` pre-request script ([documentation on pre-request scripts](http://www.getpostman.com/docs/pre_request_scripts)).  Also, our calls have dependencies. `GET`/`UPDATE`/`DELETE` calls will only work after an item is created with a `POST`.

Notes:
- Data created or modified in an environment will not affect other environments.
- Data cannot be transfered from one environment to another environment.

Questions/Comments/Suggestions
--------------
If you have any questions or comments, please let us know at [dev-api@commvault.com](mailto:dev-api@commvault.com).

item.name: 0 - Setup

exec: //set your CS username and password here

request.description:
Add your QSDK Authenticated token to your Postman Environment by providing the details in the pre-request script.

You only need to run this one time because these values are stored in your Postman Environment.

originalRequest.description:
This operation allows you to preview a backed up file on your laptop computer.

http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_file_preview.htm

response.body:
Next up: You can try creating a workflow that retrieves the IP of all machines in a client group and writes that info to a file and also sends the admin an email.



	In addition to IP. Also retrieve Client install location

	6:16 PM

	i.e. C:/ProgramFiles/Commvault/ContentStore 

	

	Think of the best way to do it for each client uniformly

	

netsh interface ip show address | findstr "IP Address"





String value = WinRegistry.readString (

    WinRegistry.HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE,                             //HKEY

   "SOFTWARE\\Commvault Systems\\Galaxy\\Instance001\\Base",           //Key

   "dBASEHOME");          





                                    //ValueName





reg query "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\CommVault Systems\Galaxy\Instance001\Base" | findstr dBASEHOME

request.description:
This operation downloads a backed up file on your laptop computer.

http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_file_download.htm

request.description:
To view the share details of a specific shared file

http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_view_shared_files.htm

This operation allows you to preview a backed up file that was shared with you by another user.

http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_file_share_preview.htm
